title: Calories in an Extra Large Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in extra large egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in an Extra Large Egg
assumptions: Whole extra large egg (~56 g), raw or hard-boiled without added fat/salt; USDA standard values.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, freshness, hen diet, and cooking method. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: One extra large egg contains about 80 kcal and 7 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one extra large egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 80 kcal for a standard extra large egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in an extra large egg?
faqs.a: About 7 g of high-quality protein per egg.

faqs.q: Do extra large eggs have more calories than large ones?
faqs.a: Yes, extra large (~56 g) has ~80 kcal vs. ~72 kcal for large (~50 g).

faqs.q: Are there carbs in extra large eggs?
faqs.a: Minimalâ€”only 0.7 g carbs, with 0 g fiber and 0.4 g sugars.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in extra large egg?
faqs.a: Boiling or poaching keeps it at ~80 kcal; frying adds fat and calories.
